DataElement.preferredName: Second Sitting Arm Mercury Sphyg Diastolic Pressure Result in Millimeter of Mercury Number
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Second measurement of a participant's diastolic blood pressure; at the conclusion of the first measurement the measurement arm is raised 5 seconds, and then there is an additional 25 second wait with the same arm on a table, legs uncrossed and feet on the ground, head supported and participant comfortable.  While slowly deflating the cuff, the first silence in a series of at least two silences is recorded as the diastolic blood pressure, in mmHg to the nearest even number.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Second Sitting Arm Mercury Sphyg Diastolic Pressure Measurement
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Second measurement of a participant's diastolic blood pressure; at the conclusion of the first measurement the measurement arm is raised 5 seconds, and then there is an additional 25 second wait with the same arm on a table, legs uncrossed and feet on the ground, head supported and participant comfortable.  While slowly deflating the cuff, the first silence in a series of at least two silences is recorded as the diastolic blood pressure, in mmHg to the nearest even number.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Second Sitting position Arm Diastolic Pressure
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: coming next after the first in position in space or time or degree or magnitude.:No value exists.:Technically the part of the superior limb between the shoulder and the elbow but commonly used to refer to the whole superior limb.:the blood pressure after the contraction of the heart while the chambers of the heart refill with blood.

Concepts.definition: Coming next after the first in position in space or time or degree or magnitude.
The portion of the upper extremity between the shoulder and the elbow. For clinical purposes this term is also used to refer to the whole superior limb.
the blood pressure after the contraction of the heart while the chambers of the heart refill with blood.

Property.preferredDefinition: Measurement; the size or magnitude of something.

Concepts.definition: Annotation used to indicate the size or magnitude of something that was determined by comparison to a standard.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Blood Pressure Result in Millimeter of Mercury Number
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Result of a diastolic or systolic blood pressure reading, expressed as a numeric value in millimeters of mercury (mmHg) to the nearest even number.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification.

Concepts.definition: A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.

DataElement.changeDescription: CDE based on the ABI manual specifications for the ARIC study.
